text: もったいない! / 目標! / 本間に急速設計中! / クリア!左限9時方向! / 外部電源に切り替え!
translation: What a waste! / Target! / Rapidly descending for real! / Clear! Left limit, 9 o'clock direction! / Switch to external power!
grammar: Commands and status reports in rapid succession using imperative form (切り替え!)

text: 切り替え終了!
translation: Switchover complete!
grammar: Simple noun + noun construction for status report

text: でも、不走がない! / ブログナイフで十分よ!
translation: But we don't have a gun! / A prog knife is enough!
grammar: がない indicates absence/lack; で十分 means 'is sufficient with'

text: 結構でかい / 思った通りよ
translation: It's pretty big / Just as I thought
grammar: 通り means 'as/according to'; casual speech pattern

text: どうするつもりだ / 使徒を倒すには近接戦闘がベストです
translation: What do you intend to do? / Close combat is best for defeating the Angel
grammar: には marks the purpose/method; つもり indicates intention

text: アスカよく止めたわ / 冗談じゃない飛行甲板がめちゃめちゃじゃないか
translation: Asuka, you stopped it well / This is no joke - the flight deck is completely wrecked!
grammar: じゃない after noun expresses strong emphasis/complaint; わ is feminine sentence ender

text: 落ちたじゃないか / アスカ / B型装備じゃ水中戦闘は無理よ / そんなのやってみなくちゃ、わかんないでしょ?
translation: It fell, didn't it! / Asuka / Underwater combat is impossible with Type B equipment / You can't know that unless you try, right?
grammar: じゃ indicates condition/limitation; なくちゃ is contraction of なくては (must/unless)

text: もったいない! / ケーブルの長さは?
translation: What a waste! / How long is the cable?
grammar: は marks topic for question about cable length

text: 残り1200! / どうするんだね? / なんとかなります / なんとかしなくちゃ
translation: 1200 remaining! / What are you going to do? / We'll manage somehow / We have to make it work somehow

vocabulary.meaning: have to do (contraction of しなくては)

grammar: なんとかなる means 'it will work out somehow'; なくちゃ expresses necessity

text: ケーブルがなくなるわ / 衝撃に備えて
translation: The cable is running out / Prepare for impact
grammar: に備えて means 'in preparation for'; わ is feminine sentence ender

text: しまった / レバー目標を喪失 / 今のうちにディスクを
translation: Damn it! / Lever target lost / Disconnect while we can

vocabulary.meaning: while we can, now (while there's time)

grammar: うちに indicates doing something while conditions allow

text: 約38回 / おーい 勝利
translation: Approximately 38 times / Hey, victory!
grammar: 約 prefixes numbers to indicate approximation; おーい is an interjection to call attention

text: カジ / 俺先に行くわ!
translation: Kaji / I'm going ahead!
grammar: わ is emphatic particle (can be masculine in some contexts); 先に means 'ahead/first'

text: 出してくれ。
translation: Let me out.

vocabulary.meaning: to take out, to let out

grammar: てくれ is masculine imperative request form

text: じゃあよろしく! / 桂木市!
translation: Well then, I'm counting on you! / Kaji!
grammar: よろしく is casual way to ask for cooperation/favor

text: 逃げよった。 / 目標、 / 再びエヴァに接近中! / また来た! / 今度こそ仕留めてやるわ!
translation: He ran away. / Target / approaching Eva again! / Here it comes again! / This time I'll finish it off for sure!

vocabulary.meaning: to finish off, to bring down

grammar: よった is Kansai dialect for した; こそ emphasizes 'for sure'; てやる shows determination

text: 何よ!動かないじゃない! / B型装備じゃね。 / どうすんのよ! / どうするって? / だらしないのね!サードチルトレンのくせに! / あ、来た!
translation: What! It won't move! / It's Type B equipment. / What are we going to do! / What do you mean 'what'? / How pathetic! And you call yourself Third Children! / Ah, it's coming!
grammar: じゃない for emphasis/complaint; くせに expresses criticism 'despite being'; のね adds emotion

text: くちぃ! / 使徒だな。
translation: Damn! / It's an Angel, alright.
grammar: だな is masculine confirmatory particle expressing certainty

text: レバー2号機、目標体内に侵入! / それって、食われたんだちゃうか?
translation: Eva Unit 02 has penetrated inside the target! / Doesn't that mean it got eaten?
grammar: んだちゃうか is Kansai dialect for んじゃないか (isn't it?)

text: こら、まるで釣りやな! / 釣り? / そう、釣りだわ!
translation: Hey, it's just like fishing! / Fishing? / Yes, it's fishing!
grammar: やな is Kansai dialect for だね; まるで used for comparisons

text: これじゃピンチに逆戻りだ / うっさいわね
translation: At this rate we're right back in a crisis / Shut up
grammar: じゃ indicates resulting condition; に逆戻り means 'reverting back to'

text: いつまで乗ってんのよエッチ / でもなんとか離れないと / アスカ聞こえる? / 絶対に離さないでね / ん? / 艦長 / なんだ
translation: How long are you going to stay on, you pervert! / But we have to get away somehow / Asuka, can you hear me? / Absolutely don't let go, okay? / Hm? / Captain / What is it?
grammar: てんの is contraction of ているの; ないと expresses necessity; ないでね is gentle prohibition

text: ご協力をお願いします
translation: I request your cooperation
grammar: を + お願いします is formal request pattern with honorific prefix ご

text: 生き残った戦艦2隻によるゼロ距離射撃 / そうです
translation: Point-blank firing by the two surviving battleships / That's right
grammar: による indicates means/method 'by means of'

text: アンビリカルケーブルの軸線上に無人の戦艦2隻を自身させ / 罠を張ります
translation: Position the two unmanned battleships along the umbilical cable axis / and set a trap
grammar: 上に means 'on/along'; させ is causative form (to make/position)

text: その間にエヴァ2号機が目標の口を開口 / そこへ全艦突入し / 艦首首砲塔の直接砲撃の後 / さらに自爆 / 目標を撃破します / そんな無茶な
translation: Meanwhile Eva Unit 02 will open the target's mouth / then the ship will rush in / after direct fire from the bow turret / then self-destruct / and destroy the target / That's insane!
grammar: の後 means 'after'; さらに means 'furthermore'; そんな emphasizes the absurdity
